thread.title: Delhi shocker: Students hospitalised after ‘dead rat’ found in midday meal- The New Indian Express
thread.title_full: Delhi shocker: Students hospitalised after ‘dead rat’ found in midday meal- The New Indian Express

title: Delhi shocker: Students hospitalised after ‘dead rat’ found in midday meal- The New Indian Express
text:
Delhi shocker: Students hospitalised after ‘dead rat’ found in midday meal By ANI | Published: 17th February 2017 08:08 AM | Last Updated: 17th February 2017 08:08 AM | A+ A A- | 0 Share Via Email Image for representation only. NEW DELHI: Nine students at a government school in the national capital ended up in the hospital on Thursday, after they consumed a midday meal in which a dead rat was allegedly found. 
The students from the Government Boys’ Senior Secondary School in Deoli area were immediately taken to the Madan Mohan Malviya Hospital, after they reported feeling nauseous and acute pain in their stomach and head post consuming the meal. 
Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, who visited the children in the hospital, took to Twitter saying “A rat has been found in midday meal in a government school. Nine students were rushed to hospital. I have spoken to doctors and the children are fine.” 
He further informed that an FIR is also being lodged and that from Friday onwards, their own officers will monitor the cooking of food in the kitchen. 
“An FIR has been lodged against the midday meal supplier and we will also blacklist him. We will not tolerate any carelessness when it comes to the health of children,” Sisodia said. TAGS
